<html><body><div><article class="news_content article-view article-body" id="articleText">
<div class="article-subtitle type01"><p>Fire at oil storage facility in Gyeongsan contained; no casualties</p></div><p class="newline"></p><div class="article-photo-wrap size-l align-c">  <figure class="article-img">     <img src="https://wimg.heraldcorp.com/news/cms/2026/02/10/news-p.v1.20260210.2d419e8b1dd14df1a853957d35c630e7_P1.jpg" alt="Flames rise from an outdoor oil storage cover at the Yeongnam branch of the Daehan Oil Pipeline Corp., Gyeongsan, North Gyeongsang Province, on Tuesday. (Yonhap)">     <figcaption class="caption">Flames rise from an outdoor oil storage cover at the Yeongnam branch of the Daehan Oil Pipeline Corp., Gyeongsan, North Gyeongsang Province, on Tuesday. (Yonhap)</figcaption>  </figure></div><p class="newline"></p><p>Fire authorities on Tuesday contained a blaze that broke out at an oil storage facility in a southeastern city, with no immediate reports of casualties, city officials said.</p><p>Firefighters suppressed the flames that began at 7:47 a.m. with an explosion from a cover of an oil storage tank at the Daehan Oil Pipeline Corp. facility in Gyeongsan, about 250 kilometers southeast of Seoul.</p><p class="newline"></p><div class="article-photo-wrap size-l align-c">  <figure class="article-img">     <img src="https://wimg.heraldcorp.com/news/cms/2026/02/10/rcv.YNA.20260210.PYH2026021004750005300_P1.jpg" alt="Firefighters are battling a blaze that broke out on Tuesday morning at an outdoor storage tank facility of the Yeongnam branch of the Korea Pipeline Corp. in Gyeongsan, North Gyeongsang Province. (Yonhap)">     <figcaption class="caption">Firefighters are battling a blaze that broke out on Tuesday morning at an outdoor storage tank facility of the Yeongnam branch of the Korea Pipeline Corp. in Gyeongsan, North Gyeongsang Province. (Yonhap)</figcaption>  </figure></div><p>Authorities responded to the scene after receiving a report of a fire that broke out following an exploding sound.</p><p>A city official said there were no reports of casualties and described the situation as not dangerous. (Yonhap)</p>
</article>
</div></body></html>
